heading: to your
skincare and haircare routine
coffee
reasons to add
While caffeine is usually only talked about as an AM must-have, it’s starting to appear on skincare ingredient lists too.
It is a popular antioxidant which negates the effects of free radicals produced by the body.
Plus, when applied topically, it is a vasoconstrictor, which means that it constrains blood vessels, reducing puffiness of the skin.
It may seem counterintuitive because it is a stimulant, but coffee can soothe red and inflamed skin because of its high flavonoid content.
Whether you’re using it as a scrub or adding it to your face mask, here’s why this aromatic ingredient deserves a spot in your beauty repertoire.
Just like it wakes you up in the morning, the stimulating properties of coffee improve blood flow and make your skin appear radiant and bright.
Need to brighten dull skin?
Coffee provides instant reduction to puffiness by constricting blood vessels and tightening leaky vessels that seep blood cells into the soft tissues.
Have under-eye circles you need to get rid of?
Java has an anti-inflammatory effect and helps to soothe the skin and bring down the redness.
Battling redness and puffiness?
Coffee, when used as a scrub, can slough off dead skin cells while temporarily minimizing the appearance of cellulite by drawing fluid away from fat cells.
Have dull, flaky skin all over?
Coffee, when used as a scrub, can slough off dead skin cells while temporarily minimizing the appearance of cellulite by drawing fluid away from fat cells.
Have dull, flaky skin all over?
The antioxidant benefits of coffee also extend to your strands, and will prevent breakage and improve shine.
Struggling with breakage-prone hair?
Head to Vogue.in to know how to imbibe more beauty benefits of coffee
